thread.title: No Surprise Here—CFPB Proposes to Significantly Curtail Arbitration Agreements
thread.title_full: No Surprise Here—CFPB Proposes to Significantly Curtail Arbitration Agreements

author: MoFo Reenforcement
title: No Surprise Here—CFPB Proposes to Significantly Curtail Arbitration Agreements
text:
<iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=28b6da9b-e85e-46cf-ba30-c4849d040502" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 
On October 7, 2015, the CFPB announced its proposals regarding arbitration agreements in consumer financial product contracts. In a move that has plaintiffs’ class action lawyers cheering, the CFPB proposes to require litigation of class claims in court. The CFPB will not ban arbitration of individual actions— 
The CFPB’ 
For more background, see our Client Alert on the CFPB’s arbitration study. Stay tuned for in-depth analysis of the CFPB’
